page.title: 18RELIGION IN THE AREA
page.content: Most people in the Thurlaston area seem to attend either the Church of England or the Methodist church. Half the people interviewed attended church regularly. Some knew their clergy personally,most liked their own church. Some villagers had been going to the same church for over 40 years. The Baptist church was built in the 1830's on the boundary between villages to avoid hostility. Sunday services last an hour. There is also a coffee morning,youth club,study group,sunday school and musical group during the week.About 70 people attend each service and about $80 is collected. Babies and childen are not christened but adults are fully submerged. The church has a graveyard. Once a year a church camp is organised. The church publish a magazine.
